characters: SHUT THE FUCK UP YOU FUCKING NIGGER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting next to the PILOT is COLONEL WILLIAM STYLES. Mid- 40's, normally gruff, but completely cowed by the damage below. The PILOT, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurricane Beth, huh? Had    an ex-wife named Beth, this is pretty   much par for the course. This area    got the worst of it, I hope these   guys are all intact-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Lieutenant. SOMEONE'S P.O.V. - RUNNING through the underbrush - ducki branches, pushing through bushes, splashing through strea LABORED BREATHING wheezes over the sound track. We're hea for a CLEARING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot pushes his stick forward, descending to tree le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up on the pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN emerge from the underbrush at a run. The BIGGER M carrying the wounded SMALLER MAN over his shoulder. Both ragged army cadet fatigues - ripped, muddy, and bloody. The Bigger Man lowers the Smaller Man to the ground and unshoulders his M-16. Face panicked. The sound of the HELICOPTER approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmistakable SOUND OF GUNFIRE from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, that's live fire! As the Helicopter comes over the clearing, Styles and the Pilot squint down through the windscreen to see the Two M huddled together as BULLET HITS kick up DUST around them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's shooting at them- The Bigger Man raising his own his weapon and RETURNING F The Smaller Man frantically waving the Helicopter down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see- Below, the Bigger Man still shooting and then he lowers h rifle and there's only SILENCE. No return fire. And then Styles sees why. A THIRD MAN. Lying by the treeline. Chest torn open by gunfire. Obviously dead. His clothes - the same fatigues the first two men are wearing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was one of their own, he just Shot one of their own men-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was trying to shoot them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us on the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Helicopter comes in for a landing, the Bigger Man kneels next to the Smaller Man, who bleeds from a bullet wound to the arm.  His face, pale, sweating. The Bigger M wipes the Smaller Man's brow and speaks softly and seriou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready for this? The Smaller Man nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full on shit-kicking dive.     Nearly empty, given the A TELEVISION plays the morning    news over the bar.  Onl inhabitants - one a BARTENDER,    the other the lone CUST smoking and picking at a plate    of criminally runny egg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the truth, Vic. You made these with a blender, right? He grins and we get our first good look at TOM HARDY - Three day stubble, dark rings around his eyes but a with strong jaw and steady voice. Not your average barfly. Somebody who maybe used to be somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't like 'em, don't eat 'em, don't make no damn difference to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that was like a quadruple negative? The Bartender takes the plate away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I at least have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ten thirty in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you've slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the law - no liquor before noon. Could lose my license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you mean "don't need no liquor license not taken away from me"? The Bartender smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurricane kept you up, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I could've used the sleep. I'm supposed to meet people here tonight, try and get some work going. He stops, his attention suddenly on the TV.    A NEWSCAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is expected to announce the grand jury indictments in the Guissepe Torres police corruption case as early as tomorrow afternoon. Speculations abound that up to ten former homicide detectives could be named in the proceedings-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender turns the TV off hastily.   Embarrassed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Hardy just looks away. The Bartender puts an empty glass down and fills it to the lip with bourbon. Hardy nods a "thank you" and reaches for the glass when t PAGER on his hip goes off. He checks the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Styles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old friend. Haven't talked to him in- 911. Can I use your phone? The Bartender hands him a cordless and Hardy dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill, it's Tom. Long time no. . . whoa, whoa, slow down. Yeah... yeah, of course I'll come. An hour. He hangs up and hands the phone back to the Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Hardy, obviously shaken by the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go out to McKinley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. A sprawling five square mile compound nestl in the Louisiana backwoods. Also damaged by the Hurricane HELICOPTERS loaded with emergency supplies land and take off, REPAIR CREWS work feverishly on damaged buildings, a while CADET PLATOONS complete morning drills around them. This is still a boot camp after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Styles stands waiting nervously just beyond the CHECKPOIN with WARRANT OFFICER JULIA OSBORNE - early 30's, attracti close cropped hair and icy eyes. In the middle of protest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is totally unnecessary-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked to see a policeman, we're getting him a policeman .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this guy you called, he's not even Army-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's former Army and the best I've ever seen in a room. Besides, he knows the territory, we did Basic together here. (off her look) You've had three hours with Dunbar and haven't gotten a peep, we need to take a different tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not Army, it's not official-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's unofficial. He takes a hit from an ASTHMA INHALER, as a '71 PONTIAC G drives through the gate and pulls up. Hardy emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his appearance) Doesn't get any unofficialer than that... The two old friends embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been better. (pause) I read about what's been happening With you... I should have called-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of trouble are you in? Styles looks at the ground.      Momentarily flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I have called you if it wasn't? If there was any other way-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get us some answers. Hardy takes off his sunglasses, noticing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Warrant Officer Julia Osborne, The closest thing we have to an in- House investigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here you are going out of house. How's that make you feel, Jules?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostile and uncooperative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.   You want to tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy follows Styles and Osborne. They pass SOLDIERS replacing broken windows and sweeping up glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official term for it is "Clusterfuck" . By the time Beth hit us, I'd canceled all off base exercises save one - a six man cadet team and their Drill out in the bush. We're missing three and the Sergeant. The cadets are in their eighth week of the cycle, nobody here knows much about them, up to and including their names. But the Sergeant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not West, is it?    Tell me it's not West. Styles' look tells him it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Christ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew Sergeant West?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was our Drill here.    Man's older than sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few years ago, the Army picked our good buddy as their go to non-com to trot out to the press to talk about the kinder, gentler military. He even did the standard video greeting played to all incoming Basic cadets across the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's a good soldier. Osborne nods, agreeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean that as a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant West's served for twenty- Three years. He's the public face of the modern Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you notice I'm not in the Army anymore. They round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exercise was one of his Section Eight "private sessions". Left around 2100 yesterday and were scheduled for pick up at 0630 this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the problem is you only got three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the problem is one's dead, one's got a bullet in his arm, and one won't talk. The one who won't talk was trading live fire with the dead one as we reached the pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm assuming that's what made him the dead one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadet Roberto R. Nunez.   Killed right in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search parties for the others are fanning out in a ten click radius from the pickup. If they're hurt and we can get to them in time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called the JAG Corps, the two cadets we retrieved are to be flown to D.C. On a transport leaving here at 1700-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which gives us about five hours. Why'd you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in interrogation said he'd only talk to a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm the closest thing to it, right? Styles stops, turning to his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, bottom line: I let those kids go out there. If JAG shows up and I don't have any answers for them, my career is finished-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let that happen. Styles exhales, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Osborne will brief you on the cadets. And Tom? (half-smile) It really is good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne and Hardy enter, stepping over broken glass and hurricane debris. Hardy looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be honest, I love what you've Done with the place-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and the Colonel go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got me through Basic and a lot of other stuff. I owe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the Tom Hardy I've been reading about in the papers, right? New Orleans PD fired you for taking bribes from Guissepe Torres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was for suspicion of bribery, it's really all in the wording-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wording and your friendship with the Colonel aside, I'm not comfortable having you involved in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtlety really isn't one of you finer points, is it, Osborne? Osborne opens her mouth to reply but Hardy cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three things. First - You don't have a choice. Second- I've never taken a bribe in my life. And Third - I'm still a little drunk from last night, so if I skip over the witty banter and move forward to straight hitting on you, try not to take offense. Tell me about the two guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurricane knocked out our Mainframe, so all we have are their dogtags. Cadets Raymond Dunbar and Levi Kendall-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi?   Who names their kid Levi-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator Jonathan Kendall, of Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... Remind me to thank Bill for mentioning that on the phone-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall Junior is still  in surgery, so he won't be available  to answer for his name or anything  else for another hour - the cadet  we're talking to first is Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in interrogation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because interrogation rooms look suspiciously like interrogation rooms, which doesn't exactly put people at ease. Is he cute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Dunbar cute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) That is the most unprofessional-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he handsome, self assured, carry himself well, does he look you in the eyes or down at the floor, does he have good bones, suggesting good breeding, does he slouch or sit up straight - these are important questions, as they reveal a great deal about this man's character so please get over yourself for two and a half seconds and tell me is he cute? Osborne stares at him.    She finally nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. At some point in there I'm gonna rub my nose. When I do, go at him with everything you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good cop/bad cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. She starts to go make preparations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Osborne? You have any donuts around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As two M.P.'s escort RAYMOND DUNBAR (the "Bigger Man") in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cluttered room with the shades drawn. A folding table has been set up in the middle of it with a chair on each side. Dunbar takes a seat in the far chair. Takes in his surroundings as the MP's leave, locking the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne head towards the Coffee Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I questioned him for three hours and he didn't make a sound. You don't have a badge, he won't talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten bucks says I have him talking in under three minutes. Osborne starts the timer on her digital watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar looks up as they enter.    Hardy smiles, cheerily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadet Dunbar, good morning! I'm Tom Hardy and I believe you've already met Officer Osborne. I understand you had a rough time of it last night? No response.    Hardy takes a seat across from the cadet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not talking, huh? You probably just want to get some food and some sleep. They feed you yet? No response.    Hardy reaches into his pocket.   Pulls ou DONUT. Dunbar eyes it, wary but definitely wanting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. You can eat in front of someone and still not talk to them - my parents did it for years. Dunbar grabs the donut, wolfing it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want another one? No response.    Osborne looks to her watch - it's been a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe later. Ray, let me say this up front - I'm not a cop. Dunbar turns away, no longer interested.   Hardy continue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be, but that's beside the point. Who I am doesn't really matter; what matters is that right now, you're in a shitload of trouble. You understand that, right? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I don't know if you did what you did in self defense and frankly I don't really care. I'm just doing a favor for Colonel Styles because he wants to know if anyone else who's still out there is in need of assistance. To be honest with you, though, I don't care about that either. Dunbar looks up at this, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know those guys, you do. They die, to me, it's like seeing a couple people died in a fire on the news - tragic, but it doesn't affect me. The only thing I care about is I agreed to do a favor for a friend and try and talk to you till your transpo shows up. You like baseball? No response.   Osborne looks at her watch - two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could talk baseball for   days. Batting averages, ERA's, I   got statistics in my brain, I   don't know how I remember them. It's    freaky. You wanna talk baseball? Dunbar, completely confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Ray, we're gonna be here five hours, we gotta talk about something. So who do you like? A long silence and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like baseball. Hardy grins as Osborne stops her watch at 2:41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked for a policeman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under military arrest, it's not gonna happen. What's wrong with baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... too slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a game of anticipation, that's the beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you like then? As they continue, we TRACK under the table to reveal a HI MICROPHONE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Styles and an M.P. listening to the Coffee Room conversat DUNBAR'S VOICE, over the speaker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I like the Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Ray, everyone hates the Army during Basic. I'll tell you straight, I hated it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did Basic here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen years ago under Sergeant West. Piece of work, that guy. I remember, he used to have these two silver .45's with ivory handles and if you weren't quick enough, he'd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: knock you on the head with one of them. He still carry those guns? He Dunbar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was also his " knife dummy" . (to Osborne) See, West used to say he could slit a man from stem to sternum in three seconds. He'd use this length of pipe to demonstrate and if you were the knife dummy, you'd spend all day getting a pipe rammed into your balls if you weren't fast enough to defend yourself. That was a loooong day. Hardy laughs at the memory and turns back to Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incidentally, Ray, I promised them I'd ask where West and the others are. Can we get to them? He looks to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead, aren't they? Dunbar looks back up at Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Styles lowers his head at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kill them? No answer.    Hardy rubs his nose.   Osborne steps forwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel saw you shoot Nunez, You're a murderer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Ray, this is what we call "good cop, bad cop". (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shouts, I stand up for you, you're grateful, a bond of trust is established. Osborne, stunned by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't want to play games. That's why you're not in an interrogation room, with one of those two way mirrors - everyone knows those things are two way, right? Dunbar looks at him good nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Now, I'm gonna go get you another donut and you think about whether you want to talk more, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Hardy smiles at him, gets up, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne follows him out into the hall where Styles waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe somebody owes me ten dollars-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me look like an idiot-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't know the object of the interrogation is to make you look good- Everyone knows good cop, bad cop - by admitting it I appeared trustworthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes- They stop, looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got four hours and forty-five minutes to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy returns, another donut in hand, Osborne behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you ask for a cop, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not telling you what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... but I would like to know about the other cadets. What they were like - nice guys? Dunbar takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about them. As Dunbar begins to talk, we FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Row upon row of freshly shaven headed CADETS stand at attention. Their first day of boot camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First day was when I met Pike.    Sarge hated him from the beginning. A man with a face of granite strides up and down the line Two ivory handled pistols on his hips. His lifeless cobal blue eyes take in the Cadets. This is SERGEANT WEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfuckers have just made the worst mistake of your lives! You have chosen to join my Army! This Army is my mother, my father, and my little virgin sister and I will not allow anyone or anything that is not up to my standards near her pretty little virgin cooze, do you understand me - give me a sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those who I deem unworthy to pass through this camp will quit, and those who refuse to quit I will kill. You ever hear of a training accident - Give me a sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my time I have killed sixteen men for the good of my country, sixteen men whose entrance into this Army I could not condone, as it would weaken the fabric of this nation's defense! This base suffers an average of three training accidents a year, unfortunate incidents that I will not hesitate to repeat if you cross me, understand - Give me a sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So forget what you've seen on Sixty fucking Minutes about the kinder, gentler military - you will either succeed, quit, or die by my hand! He walks over to a tall black cadet in the front row.   P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My power here is absolute, isn't that right, nigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir! West hauls off and SLAPS Pike across the face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hail from Biloxi, Mississippi where we string greasy coon necks up from tree branches when the mood strikes us you have a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, no, sir! West grabs Pike by the neck, CHOKING HIM. The others Cade GASP. Pike goes down on his knees, the loss of air is so great. He reaches up automatically to try and save himsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this? You lay a hand on me while I'm trying to do my duty and rid the world of you? He KICKS PIKE IN THE BALLS and releases him. Pike goes fe on the ground, VOMITING, as West stands over him, screami

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck up, you're still in formation, get the fuck up! Pike somehow gets to his feet, vomit streaking his clothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck have you done to that uniform, take it off, take it off, take it off! Pike, still gasping, can't move fast enough.    West slap again and tears the man's shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those fucking pants off, I want you buck ass naked, you don't deserve to wear these beautiful United States Army issue clothes! Pike struggles off the rest of his clothes until he is NA West turns and spies Dunbar in the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadet, what's your name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Dunbar, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to work a pistol, Dunbar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir! West draws one of his PISTOLS and gives it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar you are to stand here and guard this nigger for the next twenty- four hours! He is not to be given food, water, or clothes! If he so much as moves, you are to blow his nigger brains out, is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of you, fallout for physicals! The rest of the Cadets fallout, following West away to on of the buildings, leaving Dunbar and Pike. One with a gun, the other naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen guys quit that day.    But not Pike.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OBSTACLE COURSE
dialogues.text: The CADETS, navigating a log spanned over a PIT OF MUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time went on and the Sarge started singling people out. One of the Cadets, a small man named ANDERSON, falls from the log. Screaming, West dives into the pit and pulls Anderson out, knocking him on the head with a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson stands naked, his arms straining to hold up,TWO PAINT CANS perpendicular to his body as West berates him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd zero in on a fella and ride him till he quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson, now in civilian clothes, gets into a TAXI.   Qu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West, screaming at a weasely looking cadet named CHILDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those who wouldn't quit, he'd put in what he called Section Eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horribly dilapidated quarters. Four cadets, Dunbar, Pik Childs, and MUELLER sleep in rickety bunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washout rejects, guys he said were , "dumbfucks too stupid to know they were dead". He separated us from the rest. We slept alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same four Cadets, eating ON THE FLOOR as the other me of the Cadet Corps chow at tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . .ate alone.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four Cadets fallout on a run shirtless, with heavy pa and rifles held over their heads as the rest of the Cadet Corps files into their barracks for sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and trained long after the other guys got to turn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadet Corps, mustered. West zeroes in on NUNEZ (the "dead one"), whose t-shirt has a spot on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas lived in daily fear of being Sectioned and with good reason, too. West pulls Nunez out of line by his ear and kicks him ove towards a separate muster of our Four Section Eighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They figured we were the boys who'd meet with a "training accident" . Nunez takes a place among them.   Looking absolutely terr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying Sergeant West tried to kill you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am, he just wanted us to quit. Making it through was kind of an honor. Some of the other guys on the base told us that if you could hack Section Eight, Command would consider you at the top of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not exactly true... (off their looks) I'm living proof. How did you get Sectioned, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar gives a look that almost resembles a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That first night with Pike. I made the mistake of letting him sit down at around 0300.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us about the other guys, the ones West weeded out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were six of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six members of Section Eight on a forced run through rain. We focus in each face as Dunbar describes them. Fir up is MUELLER a tall Aryan looking blonde with a square j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller was from Tulsa, a real good ol' boy type. One of those "his Daddy's Daddy's Daddy died at Bull Run and no bleeding heart Yankee was gonna take away his scatter gun" . He idolized West. Muller, grinning, as West kicks his ass to pick up the pa Next to him is NUNEZ, a strapping hulk of a manchild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Nunez idolized Mueller. Big fella from New Mexico. After he got Sectioned he just followed Mueller around like a lap dog. He wasn't mean like Mueller, though, didn't have it in him. Next to Nunez is CHILDS, small and weasely with feral eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Childs did. Didn't talk to anyone, but you got this feeling something was wrong with him, like real wrong. Type of guy you felt uncomfortable going to sleep near. Behind Childs runs Pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike I told you about. He took the brunt of it from Mueller and West. Once they found it out he was a convict they were merciless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd been busted for Auto Theft, judge gave him the option of jailor the Army. He made the wrong choice. Next to Pike, Dunbar and KENDALL run side by side.   Kend is short like Childs, but also weak. Wheezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Kendall and me. Kendall was a smart guy, we got along okay. Pike and I tried to help him, but... Kendall falters and Pike stops to try and help him up. We smacks the him away, practically kicking Kendall to his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was sickly. Had that shaking thing, whatd'yacall it, epoxy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epilepsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Spent half his time in the infirmary. Only reason he enlisted was his father. West didn't section him till last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And those were the guys who went on the exercise with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   And that's all I'm saying. Hardy leans back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smoke, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of those interrogation tricks, isn't it? You don't give me a cigarette till I tell you more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually, I just left mine in the car and was hoping you had some. Dunbar studies him for a moment and then pulls a pack of Dorals from his pocket and puts them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brand.   Must be my lucky day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes one and lights it.      Dunbar does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you one thing. You seem like a good guy, Ray. You carried Kendall wounded to the pickup. So what I don't get is what you did to make Nunez want to kill you? Dunbar just looks at the ground. A KNOCK at the door. and Osborne turn to see an M.P. stick his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne emerge to find Styles waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not done by a longshot, I can get more out of him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can wait.     Kendall's out of surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne sit in the back of the open car as it rumbles across the grounds, headed towards the Base Hospi They sit in silence until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you join the army? Osborne looks at him, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to make banal chit- Chat like that now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. We should sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a murder case-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best time for banal chit-chat. He slips something into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Microrecorder for Kendall - didn't have- time to wire his room. Now tell me why you joined the army or I'll jab this pen through your neck. Osborne smiles in spite of, herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical army brat story. Dad was noncom, Mom was a Nurse. There was never any real doubt of joining up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a mobile of bayonets above your crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.     You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost a bet. Osborne laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's just the story I tell the girls to get them into bed. Truth is... I don't know. The whole honor and duty thing. Make a difference in the world, crap like that. Didn't really work out. Osborne studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet    that's the second story you tell    the girls to get them into bed, after    you make them laugh with the first    one. Hardy just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the straight hitting on me you were talking about, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do understand that there's absolutely no way I could ever be attracted to you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I plan to grow on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're off to a late start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So noted. They pass an OVERTURNED CLIMBING TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys really got the shit kicked out of you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine what it must have been like for them out there. What do you think of Dunbar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling the truth, up to a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What point? Hardy doesn't respond, instead looking out as they pass t SECTION EIGHT BARRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being back here. Gives me the willies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the happiest of memories? FLASHCUT TO - FIFTEEN YEARS AGO. A bunch of young Cadets, Hardy and Styles among them, doing forced push-ups by the barracks in the rain as West randomly berates and KICKS T BACK TO HARDY - As he looks away and shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE leads Hardy and Osborne down a spotless white hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally we wouldn't let anyone see him this soon, but Colonel Styles said it was urgent-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, he's the son of a Senator, so go easy. Kid gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall lies in a bed, a network of tubes in his arm.   H awake but pale, still weak. He studies his visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... I've seen you around the Base. But you... (POINTING TO HARDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Army, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coast Guard, special detective detail. We feel this incident may have put the beaches of Florida at risk. Kendall's laugh turns into a cough.   Placing Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. You're that policeman with friends in low places. Tell me, how's Guissepe Torres doing these days? Those racketeering indictments must have really been a downer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi, you got about four hours before armed men show up here, put you on a plane to Washington, and lock you in a very small dark room.  I suggest you talk to us. Kendall smiles again, not losing any of his cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done nothing wrong. (gestures to his wound) I'm the victim here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not the only victim, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my, my, how did things turn so hostile so quickly? If I didn't know better, I'd say you two were out to get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just want-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, "The Truth"? Please. There are degrees of truth, officer, always degrees. Things are not what they seem. Hardy stares at him for a moment and then gets up to leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too early in the day for me to give a shit about some pissant cadet's bad version of "intrigue". You want to talk to us, send word over to the brig. Let's go. Nonplussed, Osborne follows.    Hardy turns back at the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working too hard, Levi. I can tell cause you're sweating. And you're sweating cause you have no idea what Dunbar's already told us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne walk to the NURSE'S STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was kid gloves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have no fear, Osborne, we have not yet begun to fight. He pulls a cigarette from his pocket and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we have to question him- (noticing) Thought you didn't have cigarettes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied.   Wait for it... Osborne just stares at him, not knowing what to say next. The PHONE at the Nurse's Station rings and a NURSE answer Listens for a moment, hangs up, and turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadet Kendall-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne sit across from Kendall's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant West is dead isn't he? Kendall nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other three Cadets? Kendall hesitates, then nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel free to elaborate . Kendall takes a breath and begins, all trace of bravado g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father is a powerful man. Over the years he's used that power to protect me, in one form or another, from certain... unpleasantries. (deep breath) I am a homosexual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator Daddy must be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not, shall we say, wild about the idea. He has asked me on numerous occasions to be more discreet about my proclivities, and I have done my best to oblige him. However, in the last four weeks, I began a relationship with another cadet. What do you think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you just blew "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" out of the fucking water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant discovered this relationship and wanted me expelled. My father interceded, so instead, West Sectioned me and made sure every other cadet knew that I was gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't kick you out so he wanted you to quit on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More intrigue, Levi? Kendall stares at them, dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six Cadets asleep, all except Kendall, who stares up the patchwork ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the regular Tuesday night drill. He'd let us sleep for an hour and then wake us up, drag us out to the bayou, and work us all night, separate from the others. The door SLAMS OPEN, revealing West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, get up, get up! We're going on a little night hike, boys - muster in five on the south tarmac! He leaves as the Sectioners rise, groaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurricane's due after midnight and we're still going out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toughens us up, Pike.    You don't like it, quit. Pike pulls on his pants and shoots him the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faggot speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been in a hurricane, Mueller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking gay lisp) You ever been in a hurricane, Mueller? Mueller and Childs laugh, but Nunez looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really heard this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Popham, works in the kitchen? He told me it was on the radio. He stops, listening.    They all hear the WIND, HOWLING o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should tell him we're not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, "Excuse me, Sergeant, sir, we don't feel like going out - we don't want to get rained on." He'll kick our asses from here to Cleveland. He pulls on his rain poncho and is out the door, Nunez ri behind him. The others, getting ready, all except Kendall Dunbar comes over and puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.    We don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six cadets, mustered in front of West and a TRANSPORT CHOPPER. West hands out M-16's, sidearms, and grenades wh yelling above the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rifle, a pistol, and three phosphorous grenades to a man! This is live fire, so keep those safetied until we touch down; I don't want anyone shooting their dick off! Some chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of you may have heard there's a hurricane coming! American soldiers do not wait for good weather - they do not wait for a bright sunshiney day to do their duty! An American Soldier learns to operate in the worst conditions and turn said conditions into an advantage against their enemy! Anyone who thinks these conditions are too harsh, feel free to lay down and die, you get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LZ is two clicks North of a cabin, you are to split into teams of two

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and work your way through your designated area blasting as many targets as you can find! Each area has twenty targets, first team to take all twenty and find the cabin wins! Teams are as follows - Dunbar and Nunez, Pike and Mueller, Kendall and Childs! Mueller groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be in the areas monitoring your progress and if I see anyone drag ass I will personally slit you stem to sternum and leave you for dead! Fall out! The Cadets board the Transport Chopper. Kendall gets on last, passing West who leans in and whispers to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna die tonight, faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You're gonna die tonight, faggot" . Clear as day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one else heard it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whispered it in my ear. Hardy scratches his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi, I don't know   if you're familiar with investigative   work, but we have this little thing   called "motive" and you just gave   yourself one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to know what happened- I'm telling you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to "degrees"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't kill him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Kendall, sitting among the Sectioners in silence. terrified he looks like he's about to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell someone what he'd said, but I couldn't. Mueller would just laugh. Nunez and Childs wouldn't care. Pike and Dunbar were okay, but... When West outed me, he isolated me. An outcast among outcasts. And I'd just been told tonight was the night I'd die. The Chopper touches down on the edge of the BAYOU. The do rumbles open as West points out different team directions the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First team, second team, third team, go, go, go! The click of rifles being unsafetied as the cadets pour o of the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track with Kendall and Childs as they head away from t Landing Zoe, rifles up, heads down, side by side. Moving the brush quickly and quietly, eyes scanning for targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Childs a little, we worked at the PX together. The wind is picking up and it's started to RAIN.   Their ponchos flap loudly against the elements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started getting it in my head that maybe West had paid him, maybe he was the one who was supposed to give me a training accident- The ROAR of GUNFIRE!  Kendall turns  towards it,  SCREAMI for a moment... Until he sees Childs  lower his  smoking a SHREDDED TARGET on a tree in front  of them.   He looks noticing has his own weapon TRAINED  ON CHILDS.  .. Childs steps forward, knocking Kendall's rifle away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever point a gun at me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm- I'm sorry. . . Kendall, terrified. Shaking. A beat. Childs picks up the rifle from the ground and hands it back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's move. VARIOUS SHOTS -- Kendall and Childs, moving through the b Childs taking out targets. It's raining harder now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I could think of was West, out there somewhere in the dark. Maybe watching the others, maybe watching me. And waiting to make his move. Childs speaks, and Kendall almost jumps out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, am I alone in this world? Shoot something- A SOUND from the left. Kendall panics, pivots, and FIRES. Into DARKNESS. No target, no West, no nothing. Kendall, really freaked out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A target, Kendall, cap a fucking target. What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was gonna have an attack. Go into a fit and bite off my own tongue in the middle of the bayou. Childs could tell I wasn't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just safety your shit and get behind me, okay? I'll take care of this. Kendall nods and lets Childs walk ahead. Staring at Child back as they move on. On Kendall's face, thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was a trick. Maybe this was when they'd get me, when I felt safest. CLOSE. ON KENDALL'S FINGER - Clicking off the safety agai Moving towards the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I struck first and took out Childs, then maybe I could make it out alive... Kendall raises the rifle.    Sights Childs' back.      A of utter silence and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't tell you that. Maybe I should tell you I wasn't scared at all. But I was... (long pause) Enough to almost kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Poetic justice, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? No reply.   Hardy smiles, understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Childs is the one who shot you. Osborne looks up, surprised.           Kendall nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that came later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kendall safeties his rifle and lowers it... The SOUND a tremendous EXPLOSION comes from their right! Kendall an Childs knocked off their feet as the sky momentarily LIGH UP with the blast as a MAN SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there! Childs points to the right, where the dim shine of PHOSPH can be seen through the trees. He drags Kendall to his fe and the two take off running towards it. Kendall panting and scared, ducking branches and leaping ditches as the two sprint towards the dying glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!    HEL-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of GUNFIRE!   Childs TACKLES Kendall...

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: They hit the deck, face down in mud. It takes them a seco to realize the shots are not directed at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, what the fuck is going on-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever it is isn't shooting at us... He trails off. The gunfire and screaming have stopped. Silence now, save for the wind and rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want to go-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Childs rises and heads towards where the sounds were. Kendall, lying in the rain and mud, shivering.    Alone. a moment he gets up and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCORCHED GROUND and TREES smolder under the rainfall. Kendall finds Childs, standing down by the creek. Something lies by his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's- He stops, seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.. . WEST. Literally spread out on the ground, dead. Eyes open face half blackened, he has been ripped in two at the tor A horrifying sight. Kendall stumbles back from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did- Did you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the grenade you fucking idiot. Look at him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall can't.   He sits, sobbing.   Part horror, part re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't our area.   Whose area is This-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can anybody hear me! Childs pivots at the sound of Mueller coming over the rid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I- (seeing it) Holy fuck. .,. holy fuck, what the fuck did you guys do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him like this- Mueller raises his rifle at the weeping Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him you fucking faggot-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him like this! Kendall was with me the whole- Listen to me! Mueller, finally seeming to understand.    Lowering the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jesus fucking Christ... Muttering to himself, walking in circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pike? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller, where's Pike? Mueller looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got- I don't know, we got separated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or after the explosion? (no response) Mueller-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you not know- Mueller comes at him, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, you fucking faggot, You just shut the FUCK UP-

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Mueller stops, eyes crazed. Childs looks to the sky, whic is becoming worse by the second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of this.    To find the cabin. He helps Kendall to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Pike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he'll be there.    Either way, we have to go. Kendall nods, slowly.   The two start up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we- I mean, we shouldn't just leave him here. He points down to West's body.    Childs looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can carry him if you want. He and Kendall continue on. Mueller lingers a moment long and then turns, following them up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall, Childs, and Mueller make their way through the b The WIND and RAIN have conspired into a FULL BLOWN HURRIC The three men are practically stumbling now, leaning in against it to stay on their feet. Kendall spies something through the maelstrom. It looks like WET WOOD. He points:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! THE CABIN -- Wooden, one story, and large, it resembles a solidly built shack. It is being thrashed by the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio stumble towards the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously abandoned. Bare of any furniture save for two wooden chairs next to an empty fireplace. DUNBAR and NUNEZ shout in surprise as the three men practically collapse into the cabin. Dunbar runs to bolt the door against the elements as Nunez helps them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We finished the course and came here, Then heard an explosion- (to Mueller) Where's Pike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know. West is dead. Silence. Dunbar and Nunez stare at him.    Mueller jerks hand towards Kendall and Childs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found him. Poor fucker was Practically blown in half-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor fucker my ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better watch it, faggot, I'm not Sure you and Childs didn't do him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, wandering around Alone? At least we have an alibi-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike and I got separated-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and he doesn't know when-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember now, it was before the Explosion-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you remember now-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about two seconds away from seeing If fairies really can fly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Pike? Mueller stops, as the others turn towards the big man. Silence. They realize what the question means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't kill anybody. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, bullshit, he's a fucking convict. You know how much he hated West-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hated West, Childs hated West, everyone with a goddamn brain hated West but that doesn't mean we killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it wasn't one of us?    What if it was a local-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was blown up by a phosphorous grenade, they don't exactly sell those at 7-11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, here are the facts - Roberto was with Dunbar, Queen Kendall was with Childs, and Pike's the only one not here. He did it! The others nod, becoming convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is the only one unaccounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's dead too.    Maybe you killed Them both, Mueller-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (to Mueller) Let me see your grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were each given three so whoever killed West will be missing one. Mueller angrily digs into his sack and pulls out his gren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?   Three.     Now can we please- He stops. Hearing a SOUND outside.        Through the win rain, FOOTSTEPS on the porch. They all turn to the door.       Waiting... The DOOR SWINGS OPEN.. Pike.       Covered in BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. They stare at him as he calmly closes the door and walks over to the empty FIREPLACE. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose blood is that, Jay?       West's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any kindling for afire? He looks around for kindling.       A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, West's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I killed him. (pause) Isn't that what we all wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He admitted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right in front of us. Mueller went after him but we held him back. Pike surrendered and volunteered to be tied up. So we roped him to a chair and tried to ride out the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he just surrender? Kendall turns to her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he had a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike, tied to a chair by the fireplace while the others l for, food in the KITCHEN. Alone, Kendall walks past Pike:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kendall, talk to you for a sec? Kendall looks around - there seems no harm in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hated West as much as I did. I'm not saying what I did was right, but you can't tell me you're not glad the motherfucker's dead. Kendall says nothing. Pike looks around, makes sure no on is listening and then whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, we've got a real opportunity here. You turn me in Tomorrow and we're both fucked-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gay Senator's son who let his Sarge get fragged on a training exercise? The press'll crucify you and your father. His career will be over and it'll be your fault. But we do this different and you come out a hero. On Kendall, thinking about it.    A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller.    He's as bad as West and we both know   it. Now I can't do it, cause I'm   tied up, but we get the others to   go along-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think I want to hear this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else can do the deed, it doesn't have to be you. Maybe Nunez too, he's got a tendency to follow Mueller, but the rest of us can come out ahead - the guys who took out their Sergeant's killers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll   move the bodies out to the creek   and say we came over the hill right   as they fragged West, all we gotta   do is tell the story right. Kendall stares at him.   Disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick, Pike. He turns and walks away.   Pike watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later on I.saw him talking to Dunbar. They had been close. I was in another room when it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall, looking through the empty cabinets for food when A GUNSHOT -- From the living room. As Kendall bolts towar the noise, the air is filled with the sounds of SCREAMING and SHOOTING! He pushes through the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall, coming through the door as we SLO-MO... Mueller, sprawled out on the floor, dead... Pike, tied to the chair, bullethole in his forehead... Nunez, wounded, stumbling out the front door into the hurricane... And a badly wounded Childs, pistol out, TURNING towards t SOUND OF THE DOOR and FIRING... Kendall's arm, HIT with a SLUG, and he starts to go down. FREEZE-FRAME -- On Kendall's form, falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he meant to do it. It was just reflex - he'd already been gutshot. I must have passed out cause next thing I knew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of RUNNING  and HEAVY BREATHING. Kendall's eye flutter open. He's on   Dunbar's back, being carried thro the woods. The sound   of GUNFIRE and a TREE BRANCH SHATT next to them. Someone   is chasing them. Trying to kill t Nunez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar bobs and weaves as another volley of bullets comes from behind and we can now hear ROTOR BLADES APPROACHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dunbar bursts into the sunlight, carrying Kendall. The entire thing dreamlike, what we saw at the opening, b from KENDALL'S VIEWPOINT -- the helicopter overhead, Nune behind, Dunbar turning and shooting, NUNEZ GOING DOWN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's it. Hardy is silent.    Staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunez was chasing Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he'd shot Mueller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't see it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, I was in the kitchen. When I came out, Mueller and Pike were dead, Nunez and Childs were hit and Dunbar was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he come back for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know. Maybe to have someone to cover for him. And I wish I could, but there's no doubt in my mind he killed those men. Silence.   Kendall's got nothing more to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I think that's it.     He rises and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hardy? Hardy turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Dunbar tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy smiles and pushes out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne stand before the Colonel, filling him i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike killed West, Dunbar killed Mueller, Childs, and Nunez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed Pike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone must have got a shot off. He wasn't exactly a moving target. Styles turns to Osborne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too neat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Too neat." How long have you been an investigator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that has anything to do with-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means under a year. Let me explain what ten years of police work has taught me - murder is basic. There are no conspiracies, no grand mysteries, and no evil puppet masters behind it all, pulling the strings; murder is shitty people doing a shitty thing to other shitty people - it doesn't always make sense but it's always neat. Dunbar's our guy. Osborne struggles to put it into words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... He came back for Kendall. I don't think he's capable of murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's capable of murder, Osborne. Osborne turns, making her case to Styles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all we've got is what Kendall says, and he didn't actually witness any deaths except Nunez. He found West, he saw Mueller and Pike, but just their bodies - he didn't see any crime committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure if he'd known this was all going to happen he'd have Tried harder to witness it for you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West's body isn't in the creek bed. They stop arguing, turning to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already been over the terrain twice. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a hurricane, Bill, the wind probably moved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habeas Corpus - you have to have a body to have a crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then let's widen the search 'to include the endzone in Giants Stadium and the trunk of my car-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the body we have no physical proof. We need a confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Dunbar? I hate to break this to you, but I don't think he's gonna be all that psyched to put himself in for the death penalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless what'? Kendall will testify and that'll be enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me. A beat. Almost accusingly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean not enough to save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAG gets here in three hours.   Try for the confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar looks up as Hardy and Osborne enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Hey, Ray! Just had a nice talk with your buddy. Kendall - seems you killed three people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be my reaction too-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why didn't you say so? We'll Just drop all your charges, then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious- Hardy leans across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck "you're serious", Raymond, you got exactly zero truck with us; right now we'd take the word of a crackhead over yours, so if you've got something to say, say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Kendall tell you about the PX?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he worked there-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, did he tell you about it?   About the business Childs ran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pills, shots, you name it, Basic's a lot easier when you don't feel pain-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Childs made some side money, so what? People are dead, Ray, and the only one we have to blame is you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't shoot West-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we know, Pike did. Dunbar stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you know everything, don't you? You haven't even scratched the surface. Hardy leans across the table, looks Dunbar dead in the ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know enough to know you got two choices - you can sign a confession, in which case you'll probably spend the rest of your life in a military prison, or you can tell us to fuck off, in which case you'll probably get the gas chamber. (smiling) Am I scratching your surface yet? Dunbar stares at him for a moment and then LAUNCHES HIMSE at Hardy, SCREAMING. Tackles him to the floor, CHOKING HI Osborne, pulling her sidearm, and PISTOL WHIPPING Dunbar the head! Dunbar goes sprawling off Hardy as M.P.'s rush into the room, RESTRAINING him. Hardy gets up, gasping, and stumbles to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy! But he's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy, walking angrily towards the front entrance, wheezi and massaging his neck. Osborne, runninq to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck wasn't he in restraints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Styles appears at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, where are you going-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home, I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the confession? Hardy stares at him. ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a confession? Why don't you confess, Bill: people are dead and you don't give a shit about it! Only reason you called me is to protect your fucking job, you know this is your fault-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about West! We had him, Bill, we were there. You're the fucking Base Commander, you knew what he did to Cadets and you let him go on the way he always he has- Styles couldn't reassign him, he's a legend-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew what he was capable of and you just stood by. It was just a matter of time till somebody fragged his ass, and you know what? He deserved it. There's your confession. He pushes past a shocked Styles and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy storms across the grass.   Osborne, still following

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Hardy, you can't just leave-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you owed Styles and now you're gonna turn your back on him? Hardy whirls on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West was a monster! Fifteen years ago, I was here, I was Section Eight, I was Pike. Fuck being the knife dummy- that thing he did, stripping Pike down, making him stand outside all night? He did that every year, he did that to me. Fifteen years ago, I wanted him dead, and now I'm supposed to care that somebody offed him? Sorry, no can do. I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did more than try. You cracked Dunbar in less than three minutes, as an investigator you're phenomenal-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phenomenal at taking bribes, right? A beat.   Osborne shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was starting to believe you, you know? That you weren't who everyone Said. I guess I was wrong-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, spare me the reverse psychology bullshit! This isn't my "great second chance", Osborne. Everyone thinks I'm a piece of shit cop who took money and nothing is going to change that. Nobody will ever know what happens here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you will. Hardy stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's my job. Because people are dead. Because of the whole honor and duty thing, make a difference in the world, crap like that. (pause) We can do this, Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy looks at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half hours. That's all I'm asking. Two and a half hours to maybe get the truth. Silence. Hardy looks back up at her.     Speaking softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't shoot West...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar... He said he didn't shoot West. West wasn't shot, Kendall said he was blown apart by a phosphorous grenade and Dunbar never saw the body. They stare at each other for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne enter to find Dunbar in SHACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apologize-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw West's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creek bed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he'd been shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the phosphorous grenade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One went off, yeah, but it didn't Touch him- I thought you knew this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar and Nunez RUNNING towards the glow of phosphorous sound of GUNFIRE. They come over the hill to see Childs a Kendall, standing over WEST'S BODY. Dunbar stops, shocked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck... Holy fuck, what the fuck did you guys do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him like this... Dunbar edges closer, looking at West.   With BULLET HOLES His chest, riddled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody emptied a full clip into him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall told us Mueller was the one who found them with West's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying, then. We didn't see Mueller till we got to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar, Kendall, Childs, and Nunez push through the door find Mueller in his undershirt, a FIRE burning in the hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing hard) West...he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller was alone in the cabin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike and I got separated... then I heard gunfire. Close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did we.   Why didn't you come? Mueller looks down, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid... Mueller voice FADES OUT as he continues to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't buy it. But Mueller had all three of his grenades. Mueller shows his three grenades to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you and Kendall agree on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened next?     Dunbar shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike, staggering in through the door. The others get up from where they are sitting - it's been awhile since they arrived. Pike shouts at Mueller:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to you? One minute you're next to me and the next you're gone and the sky lights up like fucking Christmas-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been, Jay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wandering through a hurricane trying to find this place. It's gettin' bad out there- (looking around) Where's West?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (to Pike) West's dead. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Silence.   All of them staring at Pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been, Jay? Pike, suddenly understanding.      Fear creeping into his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. . . no, fuck that- He moves to the door, but. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Nunez, with his PISTOL out.      Trained on Pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto, what the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just want to check your pack-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever shot the Sarge blew a grenade first-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blame the nigger, then, huh? Someone turns up dead, you just look for the Darkest face in the crowd-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's not like that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I? The CLICK as Nunez pulls back the pistol's hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him check your pack. Pike stares at them and then throws his pack down, angril Dunbar goes to it, opens it, and reaches in. Pulls his ha out. Only TWO GRENADES. Looks at Pike. Sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. The fury of the storm has increased. Kendall, Chil Nunez, and Mueller, in the KITCHEN looking for food.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Pike, tied to the chair. Dunbar sitting in a corner, listening to the hurricane rage outside. Pike watches him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like the first day, huh?    You standing guard on me. A CREAKING as the cabin SHIFTS on it's foundation.   Dunb looks up at the roof, scared. It holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place ain't gonna hold much longer. Dunbar doesn't reply. Still staring nervously at the roof Pike looks to make sure the others out of earshot, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me are friends, right? No reply.
