dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Pike takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta untie me. (off Dunbar's look) I didn't do this thing, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hated West more than any of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, but that don't make me a killer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one missing a grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which anyone coulda taken out of my gear on the chopper. Were you watching your pack on the ride in? Dunbar starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, this is my life    here. I ain't gonna pretend I'm not    happy West is gone, but you know I    couldn't have done this. It's not     in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If not you, then who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sweeping our area and suddenly he's gone. Couple minutes later, phosphorous grenade pops off about a third of a click away-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what he says about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you gonna trust, Ray?    Him or your friend? Dunbar stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hated West, Mueller loved him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to go to prison? Childs' PX Scam, Mueller was in on it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look in my pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look.   Little pocket. Dunbar walks over to Pike's pack and unzips it.    Checks little pocket. Pulls out a VIAL and a SYRINGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Combat grade morphine.    Mueller sold it to me. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up my sleeve.    Right arm. Dunbar does to reveal a cluster of TRACK MARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That look like a lie to you? I been using solid for the last eight weeks. Dunbar sits down.   Not knowing what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that first night on the parade Grounds with you, I was bad - Exposure, malnutrition, the works. I needed something to keep me from crashing. Mueller found me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty except for Pike. He sits, nude, curled up on the ti as the nozzles blast STEAMING WATER down onto his shiveri form. FOOTSTEPS approaching. Mueller. He leans down next to Pike, speaking to him. Kindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he knew guy who had an in at the PX, could hook me up. This is before I knew what a dick he was. As Mueller produces a SYRINGE from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A covert meeting among stacks of supplies. Childs stands with Mueller, talking to a gaunt Pike. Behind Pike are a group of other SICKLY LOOKING CADETS, all jonesing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later on Childs got assigned there, started running the shit out to every cadet who needed it. But I was our class's first customer.. . Pike hands the smiling Mueller a WAD OF CASH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar staring open mouthed at Pike.    Shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becoming a morphine addict during Basic ain't exactly something you want to broadcast. Only Mueller and Childs know. A beat.   Dunbar gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That still doesn't mean you didn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw West, right?   How was he killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full clip to the body-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From up close or far away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His chest was hamburger-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's close range. You go full auto on a guy from close range, you're gonna be swimming in blood. Look at my uniform. Nothing. Dunbar looks.   Not a speck of blood on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where's Mueller's? When I came in, he was only wearing a t-shirt. Dunbar looks over to fireplace, where ashes are smolderin FLASHCUT TO - When Dunbar first entered the Cabin: Muelle standing there in a T-SHIRT, a FIRE burning in the hearth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way I figure it, West must have found out about their little business and was gonna bust them, so they decided to get rid of him first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) They?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller and Childs. One of them must've taken the grenade from my pack on the chopper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sectioners sit, stonefaced, staring out the window. CLOSE ON - Mueller's hand as it snakes into Pike's pack a extracts a phosphorous grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller and Pike, twenty feet apart, scouring the brush f targets. Mueller looks to Pike and then slips away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Mueller ditches me during the exercise and heads for the creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller stands on the hill and pulls the grenades pin, to it down the embankment. ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows the grenade to frame me and gets West to come running... . The grenade BLOWS, setting the entire area AGLOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall and Childs, turning towards the sound... Note: Each shot of Kendall and Childs in this sequence sh correspond exactly to Kendall's Flashback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West emerges from the bush at a sprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?! Mueller runs down the embankment toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know, sir, I- Six feet away from West, Mueller suddenly raises his rifl and PULLS THE TRIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall and Childs, running in the direction of the grena

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Childs' job is easy, he only has to delay Kendall long enough for Mueller to get away. Suddenly MACHINE GUNFIRE shatters the night!

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: He tackles Kendall into the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller, smoking rifle in hand, uniform covered in blood stands over WEST'S DEAD BODY. He turns and runs off INTO THE BRUSH. A moment later, Childs and Kendall come into view at the top of the embankment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all Mueller has to do is get rid of the evidence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller, still covered in blood, enters the dark cabin. H strips of his shirt and throws it in the fireplace. Strik a match, igniting the bloody rag... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And wait for everyone else to arrive. Mueller, watching the evidence burn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike sighs, finished with his story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What don't you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a lot of information to be Getting... I have to think-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hurricane outside GROWING LOUDER as the Cabin ROCKS a The sound of WOOD SNAPPING. Pike stares up at the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time to think, Ray, we gotta get out of here! You untie me, we grab the guns, get Kendall and Nunez, and make a run for it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no, we can just wait till we get back and then tell the M.P.'s-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait and I'm a dead man. I got a black face, a criminal record, and over a hundred other cadets who'll testify how much I hated West - my court martial will take six minutes. It's either me or them, Ray, and you gotta decide right now. The cabin SHIFTS again.     Dunbar stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untie me. Dunbar doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untie me, Ray. A long beat.   The two men stare at each other. And then Dunbar pulls his knife from his boot and leans d to cut Pike's bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? Dunbar freezes.   Caught. He looks to the open kitchen door where Mueller stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, get out here! The others enter the room. Dunbar, kneeling there, knife inches away from severing Pike's ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is going, Mueller.     We gotta move-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. (to the others) He was gonna cut him loose. The others stare at Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I didn't do it. Childs motions to Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from there. He's serious.    Dunbar moves away from Pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know what you did, Pike. I don't know what kind of nigger voodoo You been working in here, but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your shirt, Mueller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used it to start the fire-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got mine on, not a speck of blood on it. Not a bad trick for a murderer- you said you burned yours? The others begin to look at Mueller with new eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was freezing from the hurricane-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you took off your shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To start a fire, goddammit! (pointing to Pike) What about him, huh? Maybe he offed the Sarge and changed shirts, brought an extra one in his pack. Y'ever think of that? Go ahead, cut him loose! First chance he gets, he'll waste the rest of us, that's how they work- The hurricane, reaching FEVER PITCH outside as WATER begi leaking in through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Ray, we gotta get out of Here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cadet Michael Mueller, I hereby place you under military arrest for the Murder of Sergeant Nathan West-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck are you talking about-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are to be stripped of all weapons And placed under guard-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until we return to base, and ballistics can match your weapon to the slugs in Sergeant West's body-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Mueller pulls his SIDEARM and POINTS IT AT PIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller, what the fuck-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this- Pike, EYES LOCKED with Mueller.    Continuing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A test will no doubt link you to the Killing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to shut up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -failure to comply with this arrest is a court martialable offense in and of itself-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike, please-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although that won't matter much when Coupled with the murder charge-

dialogues.speaker: SHUT THE FUCK UP YOU FUCKING NIGGER-
dialogues.text: Pike leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid white trash motherfucker, I saw you do it- And Mueller FIRES. Pike's head SNAPS BACK. The gunshot, DEAFENING.    Then, for an eternity, SILENCE Nobody moves.   Nobody breathes.   As if time has stopped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.. . my God... Mueller lowers his arm, the pistol clattering to the floo His face, as shocked as the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't... stop talking... He takes a step forward towards Pike.    A hole in the mi of the black man's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) So you killed him?

dialogues.speaker: I. . .
dialogues.text: Almost mechanically, Dunbar begins to reach for his own g The unmistakable sound of a two rifles' magazines being R simultaneously. Dunbar turns to see Childs and Nunez, the M-16's in hand. Levelled at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that hand away. Dunbar does.    Looks to Nunez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still come out of this okay. Pike got free, he got a gun, he came after us. That's the story. Mueller collapses on the ground.   Head in hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West was one thing, but this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Mueller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You framed-him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of that matters now. We got two dead bodies and a story that explains them. You're either with us, or against us - which is it? Dunbar and Kendall, looking at each other. It's clear wha the wrong answer will mean. A long beat, until

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay- He is cut off as the WIND outside ROARS - the HURRICANE mounting to it's FULL FORCE - and the WINDOWS BLOW INWARD showering Childs, Mueller, and Nunez with glass! Dunbar's hand flies to his pistol, PULLING IT... Mueller, SCREAMING, trying to claw the glass from his EYE Childs, seeing Dunbar move, PULLS THE TRIGGER. .. . And the cabin is filled with the THUNDER OF GUNFIRE as Ke goes down, clutching his ARM... DUNBAR FIRES, hitting Childs directly in the chest... Childs, still shooting, falls back, his random spray of bullets PUNCHING INTO MUELLER who jerks like a marionette Nunez, drawing a bead on Dunbar, about to shoot, when... A great CRESCENDO of WOOD SPLINTERING and SUPPORTS BUCKLI overtakes them and the CABIN'S ROOF COMES DOWN ON THEIR H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later. The rain has lessened and the Hurricane has begun to lift as Dunbar pulls himself from the debris. Hearing a FAINT CRY from his left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall.   Half conscious, his arm, bloody. Dunbar slings the man across his shoulders as the rising begins to peak through the clouds overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar, carrying Kendall towards the clearing when GUNFIR comes from behind. He turns to look... Nunez. The only other survivor from the Cabin. A hundred yards back, rifle in hand, coming after them with a venge Dunbar, sprinting towards the clearing, bullets at his he and as he bursts from the tree line he looks up to see a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I killed the last of them. FLASHCUT TO - Nunez, chest blown open, going down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're back to the interrogation. Dunbar, stubbing out cigarette and looking up at Hardy and Osborne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have some coffee? Osborne blinks, like a trance has been broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah, sure. She goes over to the machine and pours a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot Childs and Nunez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would have killed us both. You want me to write a confession, I'll write a confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved Kendall's life-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not Pike's. Osborne hands him the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us all this in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you have believed me? Their faces say "no".   Osborne spreads a MAP out on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the cabin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know on a map. West told us it was there, we just found it. Maybe the hurricane took it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond, for you to have any chance of coming out of this, we need to locate the other bodies and examine them to corroborate your testimony. Otherwise this is just another story-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hardy, I joined the army for college money. I didn't ask for any of this - I tried to do the right thing out there and people got killed. You say finding those bodies'll help me, then go find them. I don't want to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne, walking and talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk it through: Childs, Mueller, and Nunez know they're going out on the regular Tuesday Night drill, hurricane or ho hurricane, so they plan it: Kill West, pin it on Pike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're smart about it. They know when you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy and for that to work, you have to have a witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, someone who's not involved, who's word can't be questioned. You only let them see what you want them to see, you make them believe, so when the time comes, they've totally bought into your version of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They believe the innocent are guilty and the guilty are innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they're asked, that's what they'll tell the, world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a good plan but it goes wrong; Mueller flips out and shoots their fall guy, which means they have to bring Dunbar and Kendall into the Cover story-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall maybe would have agreed, but The hurricane buttfucks the cabin-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buttfucks the cabin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all hell breaks loose. A lot of Good guys shoot a lot of bad guys and whiz, bang, zoom, happy ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why, after Dunbar drags Kendall out from under a house, does the Senator's son try and get us to put his savior in the gas chamber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bugs you too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go talk to Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne stand in front of an agitated Styles. H tries to take a hit off his asthma inhaler and gets nothi Frustrated, he tosses it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking asthma... This whole thing's driving it nuts. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I said before-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was dead right. You think Dunbar's on the level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Osborne agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I do. Hardy lays a piece of paper on Styles' desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar's confession. It should be enough to get you out of trouble. Styles looks at it and then slowly up to Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want Kendall, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to burn Dunbar to us. You don't do that if you're not involved. Hardy nods, agreeing.   Styles stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You both know if you do this, if you go after a Senator's son and you're wrong... it's not just me in the hot seat anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hardy) I'm giving you a chance to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know. Styles nods and looks to his desk.      Almost to himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get to be a Colonel without compromising. Without getting out of the way of the bigger dogs. You politic, play it safe, think of the career first. And when things get dirty, you just look the other way... He looks back up at Hardy.      His eyes, steeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of my men are dead. You think Kendall had something to do with it, then you go get the son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall lies in his bed, looking worse than before.   Har and Osborne enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike never confessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been making progress, I see. Osborne looks to her watch.   Kendall notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running out of time, are we? Tick- Tock, tick-tock, how long till your witnesses fly the coop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much time to solve the crime. Tell me, detective, how did it feel taking blood money from Guissepe Torres? Did it weigh on your conscience or did you just not think about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tried to pin three stone murders on Dunbar-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many murders did you cover up? One? Five? Maybe an even ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Osborne) Can I go to jail for punching a guy who's been shot? Kendall begins coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're giving me the wrong medicine. This isn't a very good Hospital, you know- Hardy sighs and goes to the sink to get him some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epileptic attacks are murder on your system. Rattle your internal organs like a paint mixer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart weeps. He returns with a GLASS OF WATER and hands it to Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike never confessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it got you interested, didn't it? Got you to dig. Inspired Ray to tell you terribly sordid tales about drugs and creek beds and dead little sergeants who stuck their noses where they didn't belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's that word again. (smiling) As I told you, I wasn't in the room when everyone started shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar says you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's mistaken. You know, I really don't think my father would approve of this line of questioning-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell us he shot everybody, Levi? You put him in for three murders, the man saved your life-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I should stay silent about his misdeeds? The guns went off, I ran in, Childs shot me, Pike and Mueller were dead, and Dunbar was running out the door with the smoking gun-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar was running out the door? Ohhhhhh... See that's where I was confused, because I thought you said Nunez was running out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I said Dunbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. You know, I really thought you said Nunez. I thought you said "Dunbar was gone," My fault, I gotta check the tape on that. (off Kendall's look) Oh, yeah we taped the last interview. This one too. Cause it'd be a real break for us to catch you in a lie. Silence. They wait for Kendall's reaction. He looks momentarily flustered by this... and then he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe your next line is "What are you trying to hide?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint. I'm on painkillers for the injury - they cloud the mind. You're right, it was Nunez. Any more questions? Hardy doesn't know what to say.   That was his ace card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong, Mueller and Childs were quite the pair, the type of guys you didn't feel comfortable going to sleep around. Completely capable of murder. But as I said, I didn't hear the exchange before the shooting. I wasn't in the room. Osborne furrows her brow at this as Hardy continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar will testify that you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll leave it up to the courts - His word against mine. What does his father do again? Steelworker? (smiling) Doesn't matter, I'm sure justice will be served. In any case, my father will definitely want to talk to you about all these questions, these accusations on his son. He's quite protective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne turns to Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne and Hardy, exiting the room.      Whispering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fucked, I know-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got their stories straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Kendall said - "the type of guys you don't feel comfortable going to sleep around." That's what Dunbar said about Childs to the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.    Hardy, they planned this. She grins.    He grins back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for hostile and uncooperative, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne reenter, smiling.      Kendall chuckles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something funny, Levi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking of what's going to happen to your careers when my father gets through with you. Hardy pulls the out MICRORECORDER and hands it to Osborne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you talk to Levi off the record for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, she stops the tape.    Then turns to Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Dunbar got your stories straight. Little details, little inconsistencies, designed to bounce us back from one of you to the other, asking questions, killing time, until the transport arrives and whisks you away to where Senator Daddy can protect you. You think you're just going to slide out of this? You're an accessory to murder, Levi, you're Going to jail-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't threaten me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jail if he's lucky, the gas chamber if he's not-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't do anything- Osborne laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter, Levi. We're going to find those bodies and when we do, I'm going to make sure one of them has a bullet in them that matches your weapon-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fantastic idea-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I just take your gun to the morgue and fire it into one of their skulls; then I call every newspaper in the country with the story about how Senator Kendall's gay son went nuts on a training mission-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to panic) It won't work-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will and you know why? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're not a person anymore, you're a cadet in the United States Army; you have no identity, no Miranda warning, and no rights. So I'm gonna throw you to the wolves, and unlike you I'm gonna get away with it, because you're pissing me off! She finishes, breathing hard. Kendall, totally cowed. Har trying to suppress a smile. Osborne rises for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your flight to Washington-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. Silence.   Kendall takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did get our stories straight, but not because we killed anyone. (pause) It was because I threatened him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of what I saw. (pause) Who really killed West. Osborne holds up the microrecorder and starts the tape ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed Sergeant West? Kendall stares at the recorder.   A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Levi-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Childs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was standing next to him. He pauses, taking a shaky sip of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in on the PX thing. He and Mueller and me, we were making thousands. West found out. Childs said we were just gonna scare him - Use my Dad's clout. I had this whole speech prepared about how if he ratted us, his career was over. We met him in the creek bed but before I said anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West stands in front of Childs and Kendall, facing them. Kendall opens his mouth to speak, but Childs steps forwar and raises his rifle, FIRING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, I didn't know he was gonna do it. After, he told me we were gonna pin it on Pike, one of our biggest customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they TIE PIKE to the, chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody'd believe the word of a black junkie ex-con against ours. Childs gives Kendall a look that says "Stay quiet".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me I'd better keep quiet, or I'd end up the same as West. Pan over to Dunbar, who binds his friend, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar didn't know anything about any of it. Everything he told you was true, except after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar pulls Kendall from the cabin's wreckage. As Kendal begins to talk to him, Dunbar's eyes widen in shock. ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him what had really happened to West. Told him to keep quiet about it or I'd destroy him. Because if it came out that I was involved with the whole PX scam, my father would be finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scared Dunbar into silence.  He's been trying to cover for me the whole time. We got here, you came to  see me... I didn't know if I could trust him with that kind of secret-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you framed him. The same way Childs was going to frame Pike. Kendall nods.   Crying a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little advice, Levi, next time you frame a guy, pick someone who can't defend themselves. Kendall says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened with Nunez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came after us. And I told Dunbar he had to kill him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter, hovering overhead. Dunbar, carrying Kenda spinning his rifle to face Nunez, sixty yards away. Dunba hesitates before firing, not wanting to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! Dunbar's rifle ERUPTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall finishes, wiping his face.    Osborne turns to Ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you do good cop/bad cop. Hardy smiles and gets up.   Walking slowly to Kendall's b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Childs did it, huh? Kendall nods, still a little teary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Pike, then Mueller, now Childs? When are we getting to the others? When are we gonna hear about Nunez? FLASHCUT TO - NUNEZ, in the creek bed, SHOOTING WEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Dunbar? FLASHCUT TO - Now DUNBAR, SHOOTING WEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you, Levi? When is it finally going to come out that you were the one who killed him? FLASHCUT TO - KENDALL, SHOOTING WEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't prove it! You can't prove anything until we find the bodies! Kendall, crying harder now, beginning to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to us, Levi, you're going to the gas chamber unless you tell us where to find them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe-

dialogues.speaker: MAYBE HE-
dialogues.text: And then. His mouth SLAMS SHUT. Teeth cracking together over and over again like a metronome on speed, and his bo JERKS HORRIBLY, going horizontal, SHAKING VIOLENTLY! Osborne, leaping to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get something between his teeth! Hardy grabs a fork from the bedside table and tries to sh it into Kendall's chattering mouth. His teeth, CLAMPING DOWN on the metal and Hardy's hand, drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! The Nurse bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an epileptic! The Nurse runs to the bed, pushing Hardy aside. As more MEDICAL PERSONNEL runs into the room, they usher Hardy an Osborne to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to wait outside-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a witness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter, outside-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F-F-F-F-F-F-Fuh- Osborne tries to move to him, but the Doctor blocks her p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to say something-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out, NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuh-Fuh-Fuh-Fuh-Fuh- Osborne knocks the Doctor down and runs to Kendall's side

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Kendall looks up, focusing on Osborne, a slight moment of clarity in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuh-Fucking Pike. And relapses into ANOTHER FIT as SECURITY GUARDS drag Har and Osborne from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.   Hardy and Osborne sit in silence, eyes downcast. Waiting. Hardy pulls his last cigarette from the pack, li it, crumples the pack and tosses it into a garbage can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pushed him too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have known-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could've.      Should've.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to get the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. I wanted to humiliate him. For what he did to Dunbar. For fucking over the little guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the falsely accused? Hardy looks up at her and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to break him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I. She looks back to the floor. Hardy takes a drag from the cigarette, and then tosses that away too. The door opens and Styles walks into the room.    Somber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.   Time of death was 4:42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAG's been notified and I called the Senator myself. My report will reflect that his medical condition made this unavoidable... you two had no culpability in the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's horseshit and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But it's my fault and I'll carry it. He sighs and takes a seat next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the cabin. Demolished, like they said. No bodies. Hurricane like that coulda scooped 'em up, dropped them down two counties over. We'll find them. Hardy says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you could explain all this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know where to start. (pause) I guess it was about one man framing another. He thought if the other guy got blamed, people would over look his own wrong doings. Styles nods, understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens to Dunbar now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets on his plane in ten minutes, which means you two are done. You'll understand if I don't walk you out. Hardy gets up to go and then stops.   Realizing something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're taking your command, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Senator... He points to Kendall's hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. I'm not cut out to deal with the West's of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good soldier, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said that wasn't a compliment. Hardy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun, beginning to dip in the sky, as Hardy and Osborn exit the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your car's in the motor pool.     I'll walk you over. They walk in silence, for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it'll work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. They pass a GROUP OF CADETS doing drills.    Hardy, watch them. Almost looking wistful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you never told me why you left the army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dawned on me one day that we were supposed to be a nation founded on the principle of questioning authority... and all I did here was follow orders. It didn't add up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, I got kicked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gonna stay my secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne make their way towards Hardy's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were close to something with Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... Maybe we were nowhere near. Sometimes mysteries stay mysteries. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't by any chance grown on you, have I? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, just making sure. Osborne turns to the DUTY SERGEANT. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going need a vehicle release. The Sergeant nods, walking up with a clipboard. SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here and here. (recognizing them) Hey, ain't you the folks workin' on that whole hulabaloo from last night? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible tragedy. One of those Section Eight boys worked in here. Pike. Heard he got out okay. Hardy signs the clipboard and hands it back. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to be the bearer of bad news, Sergeant, but he didn't make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant scratches his head. SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. I swear I saw them bring him and the smaller guy in this morning. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no that was Cadet Dunbar- SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Ray Dunbar?     Well, that ain't right. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw 'em get off the chopper.     White guys, right? Two OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, Ray Dunbar's black. Hardy and Osborne stare at him.    Shocked A beat. SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say something wrong- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Osborne) What runway's that transport leaving from? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CADETS SCATTER as Hardy's car ROARS OUT OF THE MOTOR POOL PEELING across the grass towards the far side of the base Hardy, white knuckling the wheel, doing his best to steer around anyone who can't get out of the way in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Large TRANSPORT PLANE sits on the runway waiting as thr M.P.'s and a JAG LAWYER lead Dunbar/Pike (who, for purpos 0ВЈ continuity, we will continue to call DUNBAR) out to i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SQUEAL OF TIRES as Hardy's car SLIDES around the corn of the nearest building and SCREECHES to a halt by the pl Hardy and Osborne, leaping out, running towards Dunbar an the M.P.s. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk to him- JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Officer, we have a schedule To keep- OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk to him now. Hardy grabs Dunbar by the arm. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not finished yet- DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna bet? JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.P.'s, escort this man off the base! DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sorry, detectives.     Time's up. As the M.P.'s grab Hardy, dragging him away. Osborne, try to stop them. Dunbar, climbing the stairs onto the plane. Osborne pulls her SIDEARM, levelling it at him as Hardy y HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Randall Pike, COME ON DOWN! Dunbar stops at the hatchway. Slowly turning back to them Seeing the gun. The M.P.'s release Hardy. Nobody moves. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go have a talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy and Osborne roughly lead Dunbar into the room, the Lawyer trailing behind, shouting: JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your entire career here- OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. She slams the door and BARRICADES it.    Turns to Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got maybe three minutes till they break it down. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right back where we started. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about baseball now? Hardy practically throws Dunbar into a chair. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more games, right, Pike?    It was you who West singled out... FLASHCUT TO - WEST on the parade grounds, now strangling DUNBAR on the first day... HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You who got hooked by Mueller's morphine... FLASHCUT TO - Now DUNBAR in the showers as MUELLER hands a syringe... HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You who did it all. Hardy steps forward and RIPS OPEN Dunbar's right sleeve, revealing the TRACK MARKS. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted revenge on West, revenge on them all, so you killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar standing in the Cabin; Mueller, Childs, and Pike, dead at his feet. HARDY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that wasn't enough. You needed a new identity, because no one was going to believe James Randall Pike, convicted felon, had acted so nobly in the face of danger - you needed a name people could trust, one that hadn't been to jail, one that hadn't publicly been West's bitch boy. He stares down at the bodies in the cabin, his eyes focus on the black man's uniform. The name on it reads - "DUNBA As he reaches for it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kept Kendall alive to corroborate your story and he did it all they way up to the end. You even gave him his own motive in case we decided to burn him, too. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do that now, though, can you? HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked into the army a convicted felon with a sentence of five years in a uniform and were going walk out eight weeks later with a different name, a clean record, and an honorable discharge - a guy who did "everything he could" to save his friends. Dunbar looks at them.   One to the other.   Slowly. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what I did, now? And of course, you can prove all of it. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can prove that you're not Ray Dunbar. Impersonating a fellow Cadet is a court-martial in and of itself- DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever claim I was Raymond Dunbar? Was I ever told to state my name rank and serial number for the record? No. You assumed who I was, because I was wearing this uniform. Don't believe me? He reaches under the table and rips out the HIDDEN MICROP DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check your tapes. Hardy and Osborne exchange an uneasy glance. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need the tapes- DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't? What else do you have on me? You haven't found any bodies yet, have you? HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've found all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar chuckles at the bluff. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh, I don't think so... OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that? DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a guess. Maybe they're not where they're supposed to be. Maybe somebody moved them. Habeas Corpus - no bodies, no crime, and Nunez still plays as self defense. Face it detectives ... you have nothing. Hardy, knowing he's right. In a flash he reaches down PUL OSBORNE'S GUN and grabs Dunbar, SLAMMING him up against t wall, pressing the weapon TO HIS TEMPLE! HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not true, Cadet, I've got a gun- DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Jesus! OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy, what are you doing- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this how your story goes? Pike annoys someone so much he gets shot in the head- DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please don't- A POUNDING on the locked door.    Hardy ignores it. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can tie you to the chair if it'll work better for you- OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy, for Chrissakes- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: WHERE'S WEST'S BODY
dialogues.text: DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (practically in tears) You'll never find it- Hardy COCKS the pistol as Dunbar screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never find it cause HE'S NOT

dialogues.speaker: DEAD
dialogues.text: A CRASH as the door's lock SNAPS and M.P.'s POUR into the room! Styles and the JAG Lawyer behind, taking in the sce STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's name is going on? Hardy releases Dunbar, who slides to the floor, gasping. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He- He made me do it- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what? DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunting- we had to hunt him- JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant, arrest these men! OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the exercise? DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There never was an exercise! Never targets, never teams, I don't even know if there's a creek bed out there- As the M.P.'s grab Hardy and Osborne, pulling them away.. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do? JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, what did you DO?! DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: I COULDN'T KILL HIM
dialogues.text: He breaks down sobbing.   Styles holds up a hand to the M STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel- STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I want to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JAG Lawyer glowers as the M.P.'s stand down.   Dunbar tries to pull himself together. To Hardy: DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I was the one he singled out. Beat me morning, noon, and night, ran me ragged. When Mueller found me, I was gone. He gave me a little taste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller showing the syringe to the naked Dunbar.   Dunbar voice over speaks in unison with Mueller: MUELLER AND DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a friend with an in at the PX, can hook you up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I didn't know, was his friend was West. He ran the whole thing. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying, son. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's easy to have all that morphine just disappear without a higher up authorizing it? Check the requisition orders, I'll lay money it's his signature on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar, alone, sleeve rolled up, arm tied off: Sliding th needle into his vein... DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was his game, see? Ride the cadets so hard they'd need something to stay on their feet. Then he'd send Mueller or Kendall to them, waving around their magic needle promising to make it all go away. He hits the plunger, injecting.   His face goes tranquil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a new thing either.   He'd been doing this for years. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every nine weeks, a new class of cadets, new potential customers. The amount of money involved over that period of time... this was some high stakes shit. He takes a deep breath, looking at them. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar moved his through the kitchen. I worked in the motor pool and hooked all the mechanics. By the time the hurricane hit, we were all in. Some using, some pushing, some both. But then something happened. West heard one of us was about to talk, to blow his whole operation. He figured he'd made enough money, had enough of the army, maybe it was time to disappear. But first he was gonna teach us one last thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West, entering the,barracks, shouting the cadets awake. DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tuesday Night drill was the perfect cover. The hurricane made it even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cadets, climbing aboard the chopper. DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He put us on the chopper and flew us to his cabin. And then he told us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six men stand in rigid formation, eyes on West. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen! It has come to my attention that there is a traitor in our midst. Someone who was going to break the code of fraternal brotherhood that I have endeavored to create in all of you. Perhaps that failure is mine. But we take care of our own. And this traitor must be made to pay. He walks down the line of the six men, eyeing each of the Finally stopping at one. Putting a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunez. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I wasn't- WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you were. Cadet  Mueller found the letter you'd written to the Colonel in your locker.  You were going to betray us all.  Now, run. He points to the door. The hurricane, RAGING outside.   N looks to the others, then the door, and understands. He takes off running out the door.       Gone. West walks over to a table covered with a tarp. Pulls the cloth aside to reveal M-16's, PISTOLS, and GRENADES. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we'll see whose training's paid off the most. You are to hunt Cadet Nunez down and bring his body back to me. If you fail and he escapes, we all go down together. The remaining five cadets, understanding there is no plac for friendship or kindness here. This is life and death. They walk to the table and gear up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning, thunder, and rain as Nunez runs unarmed throug the thick brush. SOMEWHERE BEHIND HIM - The other five fan out, rifles up, following his trail, ready to kill. DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was insanity. We were hunting a man down to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: ON MUELLER
dialogues.text: Making his way down embankment, M-l6 out, ready for anyth From behind him, MOVEMENT... DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got Mueller first. Nunez TACKLES HIM at full speed, feet SLIPPING on the wet hill, and the two TUMBLE head first into a GULLY. Punchin kicking, biting, anything to stop the other man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunez, CHOKING Mueller as he strains to reach his gun... MUELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto... With a HEAVE, Nunez SNAPS HIS NECK.        Mueller lies s DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took his gun. Used it on Childs. Nunez spins, seeing CHILDS BEHIND HIM. He DIVES as Childs fires! Hits the ground in a roll, comes up with Mueller's rifle, and SHOOTS - BLOWING CHILDS BACK against the wet r DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine what it was like. Having your friends try to kill you... Nunez slumps against the gully's wall, breathing hard. agony over what he's just had to do. DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you do what you have to survive. Closing his eyes, Nunez steels himself. Wipes the blood from his hands and climbs out of the gully.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE
dialogues.text: PIKE, creeping through the foliage. Trying to listen for sounds of movement through the storm. His eyes narrow as hears a HIGH PITCHED WHINE... The bullet hits his forehead dead center.        He crump PULL BACK TO REVEAL - Nunez in a tree, thirty meters away Lowering his rifle.      He climbs down. DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendall and I found Dunbar a couple minutes later.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: Dunbar and Kendall come upon Pike's fallen form. They gaz down at the uniform emblazoned with the name "DUNBAR". DUNBAR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came to me in a split second. Change clothes, change identities. If James Pike gets discharged he goes right back to jail. But if I was Dunbar, I could walk away from all this with a new life. But then... As he reaches down for the uniform, a SHOT RINGS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENDALL FALLS, wounded in the arm. Dunbar raises his rifl to find Nunez, standing ten yards away, gun trained on hi

dialogues.speaker: YELLING OVER THE HURRICANE
dialogues.text: NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down! A Mexican stand-off.   The rain continues to fall. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to go! Nunez shakes his head. NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gonna kill me, Pike!    Thought you were my friend! Dunbar, torn. He can't bring himself to shoot, but he can surrender either. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get Kendall to a hospital! NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was gonna kill me too! Silence.   The two men still facing each other. NUNEZ {CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I snapped Mueller's neck! He was my best friend and I had to snap his neck because he was gonna shoot me for drugs! For West! DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to do this! You go that way, I'll go this way! Nunez laughs. NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll shoot me in the back! DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed three people!    Isn't that enough for one night? More silence.   Neither moves.    The sky above, a maelst DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die out here, Roberto! Do you? Nunez, staring at him.     Deciding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you even twitch... Dunbar nods. Nunez begins backing away, rifle still trained on him. And then Dunbar spies something behind and to the left of Nunez... West. Staring down at him from behind some brush.       Watchin Nunez, slowly backing away. He pauses as his foot catches on a fallen branch. Looks away from Dunbar for a split se to step over it... West nods to Dunbar as if to say "Go on. . . " DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. .. And Dunbar FIRES. Nunez, caught by the burst, GOES DOWN. The echo of the gunshots, swallowed by the storm. Dunbar lowers his head agony. West walks down. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Cadet Pike.      You get the gold star. Dunbar stares at his Sergeant through the rain. DUN BAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. West smiles.   Tilts his head to Kendall. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd best get him out of here. Don't worry about the bodies, they'll be taken care of. Dunbar doesn't move. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where we part ways, Cadet. You tell them I died out here, or I'll come back for you. Tell them one of the others did me. Mueller, Childs, I don't care who. You and Kendall, you tell them a story. (smiling) You can tell a story, can't you? Dunbar doesn't reply.   West laughs and flips him a salut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissed. And West turns and walks away, stepping over Nunez.   Giv Dunbar a clear shot at his back. Dunbar raises his rifle, wanting, needing, dying to shoot the old man... But he can't.   West disappears into the bayou. A GROAN from the ground. Kendall. Dunbar's reverie broken he leans down, beginning to unbutton the Dunbar Uniform..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar stubs out a cigarette, finished. Hardy, Osborne, Styles, and the JAG Lawyer gaping at what he has just sai DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Nunez wasn't dead after all. He came after us with a vengeance. (to Styles) You know the rest. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bodies? DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't find them. Won't find West, either. He's too good. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bodies, no West... HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No death certificates.    No crime. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just four people MIA.    Silence. The JAG Lawyer steps forward. JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll testify to this, the corruption, the drug scam? Dunbar says nothing. JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can cut a deal for you on the Nunez killing. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're telling the truth, the PX requisition records will prove it- DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the proof you need will be when West comes back and puts a bullet in my brain. But I'll do it. I'm a dead man, anyway. Like Kendall. (looking at Hardy) We both should have died out there with our brothers. I know that now. Silence.   The JAG Lawyer looks to Hardy, all anger gone. JAG LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take him now if you don't mind. Hardy nods. Dunbar rises and slowly walks to the door. Turning back to Hardy. DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, detective.   Did you get what you wanted? Hardy shakes his head, sadly. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close. They leave.   Styles walks over to Hardy. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom- Hardy holds up a hand, cutting him off. Styles nods, understanding, and leaves, closing the door behind him. Hardy and Osborne stand there.   Not speaking.    It's do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hours and bourbons later, Hardy sits at the bar, drunk and alone. Out of place, the only one not in unifor Osborne walks in, locates Hardy, and strides over to the bar, a sheaf of papers under her arm. Her face, stoic. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven. He takes a slug of his drink. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven guys. What was it you said? You were "just starting to believe I wasn't the guy people said". He chuckles. HARDY {CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven. That's the answer to Kendall's question. How many? Seven. Osborne looks at him.    Realizing what he's saying. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the time- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the perfect time. You know what makes a good detective? The number of confessions they get. You're a good detective, Osborne. So now you get mine. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I don't want it? HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough. He pours himself another drink. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing about    taking money is, you don't have    to do anything.  You just sit there.     Maybe you don't return a phone call.     Maybe you don't follow up a lead.     But that's it.  Keep the money, your    work's done. Osborne stares at him. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven unsolved murders. And you know what? It didn't weigh on my conscience. Not one goddamn bit. He takes a slug from his glass and grimaces. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are degrees of truth, officer. Always degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Hardy. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far as I'm concerned, whatever you did in the past can stay in the past. Hardy stares at her. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not be growing on you, but you're sure as hell growing on me. He motions to the bartender for another glass, but Osborn takes his hand, stopping him. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because you're a good man, I know you'll do the right thing. Hardy looks at her, questioning.   Osborne takes a deep b OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike never made it to D.C.. Somebody took him off the plane before it left. My guess is he's already dead. Hardy stares at her. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody saw.    But I don't think so. She puts the papers on the bar. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the requisitions from the PX, the ones used to release the drugs to Mueller. West signed half of them - Pike was telling the truth. Look who signed the other half. She taps the bottom of the paper. Hardy, not wanting to believe it. He looks up at her, pained. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have a choice in this? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I can wait till you're off the base and do it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy stares at his glass.   Deciding. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it.   Let's go finish this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Styles, finishing his paperwork. He rises and turns off h desk light, bathing the office in DARKNESS. He's about to leave when he notices a SILHOUETTE in the doorway. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You have to get out of the way of the bigger dogs". That was good. Styles squints at the figure. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, is that you? Hardy steps forward, into the office. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was so good, I actually forgot you're one of the bigger dogs now. The Base Commander. The one in control. You couldn't let him testify, could you? STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you let him testify then it would have all come out. West was supposed to take care of it out there, shut Nunez up and then disappear. But it got messy and people got killed. So you called your old pal Tom Hardy, figuring if worse came to worse, he'd cover for you. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drunk- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to cover for you, Bill. Not for this. Styles, realizing what Hardy's talking about. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look- He begins to move from behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?   You've gone round the bend- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West had a partner. Someone who knew how to get things done. Hardy throws the papers onto Styles' desk. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I can't understand is why you signed these. If you'd just let West take care of the paperwork, no one would have known, but you got careless. So when Pike finally told the truth you had to get rid of him, too. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's preposterous- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toxicology report came back. Kendall's attack was caused by a drug known as anephadrine, maybe you've heard of it. It's for asthmatics. If an epileptic takes enough, it kills them. I checked with the nurses at the hospital - you're the only other person who visited Kendall. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to see if he was okay- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You poisoned him, Bill. You heard our interrogation, you knew he was ready to crack, so you killed him, just like Pike. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even going to dignify that- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You will stand there and you will listen! What happened to you, Bill?  You were the one who joined up to do good in the world. You were the one who believed in it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get into a finger pointing contest about character? The army kicked you out for drugs, the cops fired you for taking bribes from a mobster, and you think you can stand there and lecture me on codes of conduct? There's only one criminal standing in this room and it's you. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long. He walks towards the desk. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more witnesses. West's a ghost. But it doesn't matter because we have your signature, the hospital log, and Kendall's toxicology report. And that'll be enough. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't duck this, Bill. I may have done every goddamn thing in my life wrong but I won't let this happen. STYLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last time, I have no idea what you're talking about- HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting) Get your hands away from the desk! In the darkness we see Styles MOVE SUDDENLY... HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne, gun! Hardy DIVES to the floor - Osborne in the doorway, PISTOL raised, FIRES TWO SHOTS! Muzzle flare lighting the room f a split second as Styles is BLOWN BACK against the wall! Hardy gets to his feet and flicks on the LIGHT. Styles li slumped in the corner, two holes in his chest. Dead. Osborne lowers her weapon, shaking. Hardy points to the top desk drawer, which is open. Insid it sits an IVORY HANDLED PISTOL. Fully loaded, safety off It's presence tells them everything they need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's West's, isn't it? Hardy nods and then turns to look down at Styles' body. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aftermath. Flashing blue and red lights from parked Military Police vehicles illuminate the grounds as M.P. ' string crime scene tape around the front entrance of the building, securing the site for investigation. Hardy takes in the entire scene from afar. Standing by hi GTO, watching as several M.P.'s finish questioning Osborn When she's done she spies Hardy and walks over to him. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out here? HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving without saying goodbye. What are you gonna do? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it'll work? OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want company? Osborne smiles. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A word of advice about women - that first hour or so after they kill their boss? Probably not the best time to hit on them. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably write that down. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. . Hardy pulls a card from his pocket and hands it to her. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your phone number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you need me to testify about the shooting. They'll clear you. A beat. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was your friend. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But he was a lot of other things, too. Thanks. She nods.   An awkward moment.      Finally: HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you. He turns away.   Walking towards his car. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hardy! He turns back. She walks up and holds something out to hi A ten dollar bill. OSBORNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you this. He looks down at the money. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life tonight. Keep it. (pause) Actually, don't keep it, I need the money. He takes the bill and Osborne laughs. He climbs into his car and starts it. Grinning at her through the open windo HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of the good ones, Osborne. Don't sweat the details. He puts the GTO in gear and drives off. She watches him g then looks down at his card. Smiling. Maybe she will call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bottle of Scotch at her side, Osborne slips a tape mark "BASIC TRAINING INTRO - SGT. N. WEST" into her VCR. Settl back to watch it. West's face fills the screen. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Cadets. The art of warfare is simple and complex. Simple in its goal, complex in its execution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's started to rain.    Hardy drives in silence. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sun Tzu writes, the true warfare is deception. A HITCHHIKER up ahead.    Hardy pulls over for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne, drinking and watching. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At all times you must confuse your enemies, surrounding them with uncertainty, giving them false hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hitchhiker gets into the car. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At all times, you must mask your true intentions. Hardy, smiling at him, because the Hitchhiker is not a Hitchhiker at all... HARDY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you ask for a cop, Ray? The Hitchhiker is Dunbar. OSBORNE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got their stories straight. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 hours ago. The hurricane rages. A HAND pulls the PIN o a phosphorous grenade and CHUCKS IT. It blows, frying brush and nothing more. West comes over the hill, running to investigate. He stop at what he sees. Nunez stands unarmed in the creek bed, SURROUNDED by the other Section Eight Cadets. A prisoner. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on? DUNBAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your weapons, Sergeant. West doesn't move. Kendall walks over and DISARMS West, pushing him into the circle next to the terrified Nunez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about that little drug business you all are running? Yeah, I know about that, Roberto told me- NUNEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!    Look, we won't say anything- WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that. You little pissers really think you can throw a scare into me? Dunbar raises his rifle and SHOOTS NUNEZ. He goes down, twitches once and lies still. Dead. West looks at Dunbar. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to do a lot better than that, son. HARDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this? And with that, Tom Hardy emerges from the brush carrying, COMBAT KNIFE. West's eyes sparkle with recognition. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I kick your ass out for this drug thing fifteen years ago? Hardy just smiles. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've known you were involved in this. Come on then. Let's see you try and stick me- Moving faster than   West thought imaginable, Hardy moves the knife FLASHES,   CUTTING WEST OPEN stem to sternum. H grips the older man   by the shoulders, lowering him to t ground as he dies.    Whispering in his ear: HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stem to sternum. You taught me well, Sarge. And WEST DIES. A moment of utter silence and then VOICES FROM THE PAST begin coming back to us: STYLES (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you could explain all this to me? Kendall walks over to Hardy and hands him a PISTOL. HARDY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know where to start. Kendall holds out his arm, gritting his teeth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it was about one man framing another... And Hardy SHOOTS Kendall once, THROUGH THE ARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mueller and Childs lay NUNEZ's DEAD BODY out in the brush The sound of the Helicopter approaching...

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: Dunbar raises his rifle and FIRES towards the tree line. Aiming at nothing. The Helicopter comes into view overhea DUST KICKS UP around Dunbar and Kendall - bullet hits. HARDY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy.. . ON STYLES' FACE - Watching this through the windscreen. STYLES (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who won't talk was trading live fire with the dead one as we reached the pick-up. RACK FOCUS TO - Hardy, concealed in the woods, FIRING at Dunbar and Kendall's feet to simulate Nunez shooting at t Dunbar, shooting towards where Nunez's body lies. Making look like he just killed Nunez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardy arriving at the Fort, EMBRACING STYLES. HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for that to work, you have to have a witness... PAN OVER to OSBORNE, watching. HARDY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who's not involved, who's word can't be questioned... VARIOUS SHOTS -- Of Hardy and Osborne, investigating the case, talking to Dunbar, talking to Kendall... HARDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only let them see what you want them to see, you make them believe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osborne, showing Hardy the requisition forms. OSBORNE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
